children.name: Discover US Government Information
children.desc: Massive new front end to the US government.

children.name: Geospatial Platform
children.desc: GeoPlatform users have access to a one-stop shop that delivers a focal point where governmental, academic, private, and public data can be visualized together to inform national and regional issues

children.name: Open Government Data
children.desc: Here you will find data, tools, and resources to conduct research, develop web and mobile applications, design data visualizations, and more.

children.name: US Govt bulk data downloads
children.desc: Congressional Bills, Commerce Business Daily, Code of Federal Regulations, Federal Register, US Govt Manual, Public Papers of the Presidents of the United States, Supreme Court Decisions 1937-1975

children.name: USDA Economic Research Service
children.desc: We provide leadership on food, agriculture, natural resources, rural development, nutrition, and related issues based on public policy, the best available science, and effective management.

children.name: USDA Food and Nutrition Service
children.desc:
Includes data on these USDA programs:
Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP), Food Distribution Programs, School Meals, Women, Infants and Children

children.name: USDA Foreign Agricultural Service
children.desc:
Information on U.S. export sales, by commodity and country of destination,
insight and analysis on issues affecting agricultural production and trade.

children.name: USDA National Agricultural Statistics Service
children.desc: The National Agricultural Statistics Service provides timely, accurate, and useful statistics in service to U.S. agriculture.

children.name: Advanced Manufacturing Portal
children.desc: By coordinating federal resources and programs, the Advanced Manufacturing National Program Office enhances technology transfer in U.S. manufacturing industries and helps companies overcome technical obstacles to scale up of new technologies and products.

children.name: Income Distribution Across America
children.desc: Currently in alpha the MIDAAS system allows the exploration of Income distribution in the United States. This site democratizes insights from open government data.

children.name: Visitors Arrival Program
children.desc: The International Visitor Arrivals Program provides the U.S. government and the public with the official monthly and annual overseas visitor arrivals to the United States. The National Travel and Tourism Office (NTTO) manages the program in cooperation with the Department of Homeland Security, Customs and Border Protection (CBP).

children.name: Computer Forensic Reference Data Sets
children.desc: NIST is developing Computer Forensic Reference Data Sets (CFReDS) for digital evidence. These reference data sets (CFReDS) provide to an investigator documented sets of simulated digital evidence for examination.

children.name: National Institute of Standards and Technology
Coral Health and Monitoring Program
children.desc: to provide services and information sources for researchers and the public in order to help improve and sustain coral reef health throughout the world.

children.name: NOAA Climate datasets
children.desc: datasets and other resources related to climate.

children.name: Storm Events Data
children.desc: NCDC Storm Event database contains a chronological listing, by state, of hurricanes, tornadoes, thunderstorms, hail, floods, drought conditions, lightning, high winds, snow, temperature extremes and other weather phenomena, from 1950 to the present.

children.name: Annual Survey of Entrepreneurs
children.desc: The ASE provides annual data on select economic and demographic characteristics of employer businesses and their owners by gender, ethnicity, race, and veteran status.

children.name: Family Planning Centers
children.desc: An Industry Snapshot from the Census Bureau covering 2008-2013.  It includes locations, payroll, revenue, pop. served, etc.

children.name: Current Population Survey
children.desc: In addition to being the primary source of monthly labor force statistics, the CPS adds a set of supplemental questions which vary month to month and cover topics such as child support, volunteerism, health insurance coverage, and school enrollment.

children.name: Economic Census
children.desc: List of indicators made available by the Census Bureau with companion tools for exploration.

children.name: Industry Statistics Portal
children.desc: Census Bureau application that searches across programs that provide economic data for a user-selected industry. To choose the industry you are interested in use the NAICS code or keyword.

children.name: Small Area Health Insurance Estimates
children.desc: The Small Area Health Insurance Estimates (SAHIE) program was created to develop model-based estimates of health insurance coverage for counties and states.

children.name: USA Trade Online
children.desc: USA Trade Online is a dynamic data tool that gives users access to current and cumulative U.S. export and import data.  This tool can support economists in performing academic research, as well as helping form trade policies.

children.name: data.mil
children.desc: In providing the military forces needed to deter war and protect the security of our country, the U.S. Department of Defense generates vast troves of data.

children.name: Civil Rights Data Collection
children.desc: compare data across school districts

children.name: ED Data Inventory
children.desc: The goal of the ED Data Inventory is to describe all data reported to the Department of Education, with the exception of personnel and administrative data. It includes data collected as part of grant activities, along with statistical data collected to allow publication of valuable statistics about the state of education in this country.

children.name: Federal Student Aid Data Center
children.desc: The Federal Student Aid Data Center is your centralized source for information relating to the federal financial assistance programs.

children.name: Graduate Earnings Data for Career College Programs
children.desc: US Dept. of Education data showing the typical earnings of graduates of the thousands of career training programs offered by colleges across the country. This is intended to help students make more informed decisions about college enrollment .

children.name: National Center for Education Statistics
children.desc: Topics outlined include the participation of students, teachers, and faculty in U.S. educational institutions; the personnel, performance and payrolls of U.S. public schools and in comparison to students in other countries.

children.name: Alternative Fueling Stations
children.desc: Alternative fueling stations are located throughout the United States and their availability continues to grow. The Alternative Fuels Data Center (AFDC) maintains a website where you can find alternative fuels stations near you or on a route, obtain counts of alternative fuels stations by state, view U.S. maps, and more.

children.name: Atmospheric Radiation Measurement - Climate Research Facility
children.desc: ARM focuses on obtaining continuous measurements—supplemented by field campaigns—and providing data products that promote the advancement of climate models.

children.name: DOE Data Explorer
children.desc: Discover science, technology, engineering research and data collections from the US Department of Energy

children.name: Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory - Institutes Office
Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory - Standby Data
National Renewable Energy Laboratory - The Open PV Project
Oak Ridge National Laboratory - Computer Science and Mathematics Division
Office of Scientific and Technical Information
Pacific Northwest National Laboratory - Proteomics Research Resource for Integrative Biology
DHHS
children.desc: Dept. of Health and Human Services

children.name: National Cancer Insitute
children.desc: NCI Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results Program Turning Cancer Data Into Discovery

children.name: ClinicalTrials.gov
children.desc: ClinicalTrials.gov is a Web-based resource that provides patients, their family members, health care professionals, researchers, and the public with easy access to information on publicly and privately supported clinical studies on a wide range of diseases and conditions.

children.name: National Data Archive on Child Abuse and Neglect
children.desc: NDACAN disseminates datasets of archived research for secondary analysis with statistical software such as SPSS or SAS. They do not maintain statistics on child abuse and neglect or provide reports of research findings.

children.name: Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration
children.desc: SAMHSA is the agency within the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services that leads public health efforts to advance the behavioral health of the nation.  Datasets are related to facilities, clients and emergency room visits.

children.name: Drugs of Abuse
children.desc: Learn the facts about the most commonly abused drugs.  Included are substances such as bath salts, fentanyl, marijuana, ketamine, alcohol, etc.

children.name: Aging Statistics
children.desc: This report provides the latest data on the 41 key indicators selected by the Forum to portray aspects of the lives of older Americans and their families.

children.name: Behavioral Risk Factors
children.desc: BRFSS is used to collect prevalence data among adult U.S. residents regarding their risk behaviors and preventive health practices that can affect their health status. Examples range from infant mortality and suicide rates to seat belt use, binge drinking and obesity.

children.name: CDC - Sexual Health
children.desc: an array of datasets related to sexual health, risk, behavior, etc.

children.name: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
WISQARS
children.desc: CDC’s Web-based Injury Statistics Query and Reporting System provides data related to fatal and nonfatal injury, violent death, and cost of injury data illustraing the economic burden associated with unintentional and violence-related injury in the US.

children.name: Longitudinal Studies of Aging
children.desc: The Longitudinal Studies of Aging (LSOAs) is a multicohort study of persons 70 years of age and over designed primarily to measure changes in the health, functional status, living arrangements, and health services utilization of two cohorts of Americans as they move into and through the oldest ages.

children.name: National Vital Statistics
children.desc: Natality, mortality, infant mortality.  Rapid Release provides more up to date data than the annual archive, including both interactive tools and downloadable public use data files.

children.name: HRSA
children.desc: Health Resources and Services Administration is the primary Federal agency for improving health care to people who are geographically isolated, economically or medically vulnerable.

children.name: Health Resources and Services Administration
children.desc: A variety of datasets pertaining to the availability and distribution of health care services and resources.

children.name: H*CUPnet
children.desc: The Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality provides statistics for hospital inpatient, emergency department, and ambulatory settings, as well as population-based health care data on counties.  The focus is on the patient, hospital stays, emergency room visits, etc.

children.name: Medical Expenditure Panel Survey
children.desc: The Medical Expenditure Panel Survey (MEPS) is a set of large-scale surveys of families and individuals, their medical providers, and employers across the United States. MEPS is the most complete source of data on the cost and use of health care and health insurance coverage.

children.name: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services
CMS Data Navigator
children.desc: Very rich source of health care data including points of service, patients providers, services, trends, and a fraud database.

children.name: Hospital Compare
children.desc: These are the official datasets used on the Medicare.gov Hospital Compare Website provided by the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services. These data allow you to compare the quality of care at over 4,000 Medicare-certified hospitals across the country

children.name: Open Payments
children.desc: Open Payments is a federal program, required by the Affordable Care Act, that collects information about the payments drug and device companies make to physicians and teaching hospitals for things like travel, research, gifts, speaking fees, and meals.

children.name: Immigration Data & Statistics
children.desc: The Office of Immigration Statistics is charged to collect and disseminate data useful in evaluating the impact of immigration laws.

children.name: Biodiversity and species data
children.desc: Biodiversity Information Serving Our Nation (BISON) -  Explore & download U.S. species occurrence data & maps

children.name: Earthquakes (USGS)
children.desc: This web site is sponsored by the USGS Earthquake Hazards Program, as part of our effort to provide and apply relevant earthquake science information and knowledge to reduce deaths, injuries, and property damage from earthquakes.

children.name: OJP Diagnostic Center
children.desc: The Office of Justice Programs (OJP) Diagnostic Center is a technical assistance resource designed to provide local leaders with customized training and technical assistance (TTA) in addressing persistent and emerging public safety problems using evidence-based strategies

children.name: United States Sentencing Commission
children.desc: The Sentencing Commission is an independent agency in the judicial branch whose mission includes collecting, analyzing and distributing a broad array of information on federal crime and sentencing issues.

children.name: Bureau of Justice Statistics
children.desc: To collect, analyze, publish, and disseminate information on crime, criminal offenders, victims of crime, and the operation of justice systems at all levels of government. These data are critical to federal, state, and local policymakers in combating crime and ensuring that justice is both efficient and evenhanded.

children.name: Occupational Safety and Health
children.desc: Appears to provide data on complaints of civil rights violations.

children.name: Data Finder
children.desc: Data Finder is a new search and navigation tool for BLS time series data available on the BLS website. Rather than searching individual data sets, Data Finder allows users to conveniently search multiple data sets all at once.

children.name: State and Metro Area Employment, Hours, & Earnings
Federal Railroad Administration - Office of Safety Analysis
Freight Analysis Framework
children.desc: The Freight Analysis Framework (FAF), produced through a partnership between Bureau of Transportation Statistics (BTS) and Federal Highway Administration (FHWA), integrates data from a variety of sources to create a comprehensive picture of freight movement among states and major metropolitan areas by all modes of transportation.

children.name: Border Crossing Data
children.desc: The Bureau of Transportation Statistics (BTS) Border Crossing/Entry Data provides summary statistics for trucks, trains, containers, buses, personal vehicles, passengers, and pedestrians.

children.name: Explore Topics and Geography
children.desc: Select a topic, geographic region, or mode of transportation to explore information about the transportation system.

children.name: National Transportation Atlas
children.desc: Download gis data, shapefiles, points and/or polygons for use with BTS datasets

children.name: Transportation.gov (geospatial)
children.desc: Data and Maps pertaining to aviation, rail, highways, vehicles, bicycles, passengers, freight, border crossings, deficient bridges, etc.

children.name: National Center for Veterans Analysis and Statistics
children.desc: We develop statistical analyses and reports on a broad range of topics, operate VA’s data and statistics Web portal to disseminate Veteran data and statistics, and develop estimates and projections on Veteran populations.

children.name: US Courts Caseload Statistics
children.desc: This section of uscourts.gov provides statistical data on the business of the federal Judiciary. Specific publications address the work of the appellate, district, and bankruptcy courts; the probation and pretrial services systems; and other components of the U.S. courts.

children.name: American Community Survey
children.desc: Select State and Municipality

children.name: Open Data for US cities
children.desc: By collecting and analyzing data from a variety of government and private sources, we're able to create detailed, informative profiles for every city in the United States.

children.name: State of the Cities
children.desc: Profile of major cities provided by HUD.

children.name: US City Open Data Census
children.desc: City data presented in a visual matrix

children.name: City Data
children.desc: The US City Open Data Census is an ongoing, crowdsourced measure of the current state of access to a selected group of datasets in municipalities across the United States.
